posts.name: Cameron (Advanced Programmer)
posts.cooked:
Did this last year … Found it useful.

FRC Game Tools FRC Game Tools Download (Direct Download Link) Radio Configuration Tool Programming your Radio WPILIB Docs

WPILIB Installer Release WPILib 2024.1.1 Release · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub

CTRE Phoenix (At the time of creation this has yet to have a 2024 non beta release) CTRE Install Docs CTRE Tuner X Phoenix Tuner X - Official app in the Microsoft Store

REV Hardware Client REV Hardware Client Overview - REV Hardware Client REV API Downloads (STILL 2023 DOCS) REVLib Information - SPARK MAX REV online install link https://software-metadata.revrobotics.com/REVLib-2024.json

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked:
Most of those are covered in the official docs here: Step 2: Installing Software — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

But definitely nice to have it all together.

posts.name: William
posts.cooked: Does anyone know when the new rev api will be released?

posts.name: billbo911
posts.cooked: As of 10:00pm MST last night, WPILib 2024 really had a hate fest with the vendordep for 2024.

posts.name: William
posts.cooked: A hate fest … What happend ? All i know is that rev api for labview isn’t out yet

posts.name: billbo911
posts.cooked: First off, though I have mentored for 20 years now, I am NOT a programmer or programming mentor. So, it is very likely that I am just not familiar with the process of cleaning up code when new vendordeps and WPILib versions are used. As far as I can tell, I need to clean up deprecated function calss for the new versions, but… like I said, I am not experienced in this area, yet.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked:
Can you clarify what you mean by “hate fest with the vendordep”?  Was there a thread I didn’t see?

It’s very common to need to make changes when upgrading between major versions (season releases are generally viewed as major releases), so that shouldn’t be a surprise for anyone.

posts.name: billbo911
posts.cooked:
Hey Fletch. Read my post right above yours. It explains why I am not familiar with the actions that I need to follow that were a surprise to me.

I certain I will figure out what I need to do.

posts.name: William
posts.cooked: Fair enough. was a little confused when you said hatefest but now it makes sense. Yeah since the new api for rev hasn’t dropped it is probably causing issues like you said and it’s just the unfortunate task of going through and cleaning up code.

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Yes, that’s the one I replied to.  I was just curious what prompted the earlier message.

posts.name: William
posts.cooked: Just got the link to the API release on another post. here is a link to that post so all info is everwhere someone might find it. REV Robotics - 2023/24 Product Releases & Updates - #269 by Amicus1

Here’s the link for the 2024 SPARK MAX software:

https://docs.revrobotics.com/brushless/spark-max/revlib

They’re updating their website so things are a little disorganized.
